Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the potential ability of the IRS to deny or delay health care.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the IRS will have control over a national database of personal health information and suggests that this could lead to denial or delay of health care based on political beliefs.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the assertion that the IRS will have the ability to deny or delay health care.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the IRS's role in implementing the health care law that do not involve denying or delaying health care.
